enum.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT
enum.description: Micro air vehicle / autopilot classes. This identifies the individual model.

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC
entry.description: Generic autopilot, full support for everything

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_RESERVED
entry.description: Reserved for future use.

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_SLUGS
entry.description: SLUGS autopilot, http://slugsuav.soe.ucsc.edu

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_ARDUPILOTMEGA
entry.description: ArduPilotMega / ArduCopter, http://diydrones.com

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_OPENPILOT
entry.description: OpenPilot, http://openpilot.org

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot only supporting simple waypoints

enum.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE
enum.description: These values define the type of firmware release. These values indicate the first version or release of this type. For example the first alpha release would be 64, the second would be 65.

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_DEV
entry.description: development release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_ALPHA
entry.description: alpha release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_BETA
entry.description: beta release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_RC
entry.description: release candidate

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_OFFICIAL
entry.description: official stable release

enum.name: MAV_CMD
enum.description: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Navigate to MISSION.
entry.param: Hold time in decimal seconds. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at MISSION for rotary wing)
Acceptance radius in meters (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the MISSION counts as reached)
0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius in meters to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.
Desired yaw angle at MISSION (rotary wing)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_UNLIM
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION an unlimited amount of time
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TURNS
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION for X turns
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
Forward moving aircraft this sets exit xtrack location: 0 for center of loiter wp, 1 for exit location. Else, this is desired yaw angle

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TIME
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION for X seconds
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
Forward moving aircraft this sets exit xtrack location: 0 for center of loiter wp, 1 for exit location. Else, this is desired yaw angle

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RETURN_TO_LAUNCH
entry.description: Return to launch location

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND
entry.description: Land at location

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Takeoff from ground / hand
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
Yaw angle (if magnetometer present), ignored without magnetometer

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND_LOCAL
entry.description: Land at local position (local frame only)
entry.param: Maximum accepted offset from desired landing position [m] - computed magnitude from spherical coordinates: d = sqrt(x^2 + y^2 + z^2), which gives the maximum accepted distance between the desired landing position and the position where the vehicle is about to land

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF_LOCAL
entry.description: Takeoff from local position (local frame only)
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor [rad]
Yaw angle [rad] (if magnetometer or another yaw estimation source present), ignored without one of these

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FOLLOW
entry.description: Vehicle following, i.e. this waypoint represents the position of a moving vehicle
entry.param: Following logic to use (e.g. loitering or sinusoidal following) - depends on specific autopilot implementation
Ground speed of vehicle to be followed
Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_CONTINUE_AND_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Continue on the current course and climb/descend to specified altitude. When the altitude is reached continue to the next command (i.e., don't proceed to the next command until the desired altitude is reached.
entry.param: Climb or Descend (0 = Neutral, command completes when within 5m of this command's altitude, 1 = Climbing, command completes when at or above this command's altitude, 2 = Descending, command completes when at or below this command's altitude.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TO_ALT
entry.description: Begin loiter at the specified Latitude and Longitude. If Lat=Lon=0, then loiter at the current position. Don't consider the navigation command complete (don't leave loiter) until the altitude has been reached. Additionally, if the Heading Required parameter is non-zero the aircraft will not leave the loiter until heading toward the next waypoint.
entry.param: Radius in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, negative counter-clockwise, 0 means no change to standard loiter.
Forward moving aircraft this sets exit xtrack location: 0 for center of loiter wp, 1 for exit location

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW
entry.description: Being following a target
entry.param: System ID (the system ID of the FOLLOW_TARGET beacon). Send 0 to disable follow-me and return to the default position hold mode
altitude flag: 0: Keep current altitude, 1: keep altitude difference to target, 2: go to a fixed altitude above home
TTL in seconds in which the MAV should go to the default position hold mode after a message rx timeout

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW_REPOSITION
entry.description: Reposition the MAV after a follow target command has been sent
entry.param: Camera q1 (where 0 is on the ray from the camera to the tracking device)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Region of intereset mode. (see MAV_ROI enum)
MISSION index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PATHPLANNING
entry.description: Control autonomous path planning on the MAV.
entry.param: 0: Disable local obstacle avoidance / local path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable local path planning, 2: Enable and reset local path planning
0: Disable full path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable, 2: Enable and reset map/occupancy grid, 3: Enable and reset planned route, but not occupancy grid
Yaw angle at goal, in compass degrees, [0..360]

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SPLINE_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Navigate to MISSION using a spline path.
entry.param: Hold time in decimal seconds. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at MISSION for rotary wing)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Takeoff from ground using VTOL mode

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_LAND
entry.description: Land using VTOL mode

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_GUIDED_ENABLE
entry.description: hand control over to an external controller

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_DELAY
entry.description: Delay the next navigation command a number of seconds or until a specified time
entry.param: Delay in seconds (decimal, -1 to enable time-of-day fields)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the NAV/ACTION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DELAY
entry.description: Delay mission state machine.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Ascend/descend at rate. Delay mission state machine until desired altitude reached.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DISTANCE
entry.description: Delay mission state machine until within desired distance of next NAV point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_YAW
entry.description: Reach a certain target angle.
entry.param: speed during yaw change:[deg per second]
direction: negative: counter clockwise, positive: clockwise [-1,1]

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the CONDITION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE
entry.description: Set system mode.
entry.param: Mode, as defined by ENUM MAV_MODE
Custom mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.
Custom sub mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP
entry.description: Jump to the desired command in the mission list. Repeat this action only the specified number of times

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED
entry.description: Change speed and/or throttle set points.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME
entry.description: Changes the home location either to the current location or a specified location.
entry.param: Use current (1=use current location, 0=use specified location)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER
entry.description: Set a system parameter. Caution! Use of this command requires knowledge of the numeric enumeration value of the parameter.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_RELAY
entry.description: Set a relay to a condition.
entry.param: Setting (1=on, 0=off, others possible depending on system hardware)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_RELAY
entry.description: Cycle a relay on and off for a desired number of cyles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SERVO
entry.description: Set a servo to a desired PWM value.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_SERVO
entry.description: Cycle a between its nominal setting and a desired PWM for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FLIGHTTERMINATION
entry.description: Terminate flight immediately

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_ALTITUDE
entry.description: Change altitude set point.
entry.param: Mav frame of new altitude (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAND_START
entry.description: Mission command to perform a landing. This is used as a marker in a mission to tell the autopilot where a sequence of mission items that represents a landing starts. It may also be sent via a COMMAND_LONG to trigger a landing, in which case the nearest (geographically) landing sequence in the mission will be used. The Latitude/Longitude is optional, and may be set to 0/0 if not needed. If specified then it will be used to help find the closest landing sequence.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_RALLY_LAND
entry.description: Mission command to perform a landing from a rally point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GO_AROUND
entry.description: Mission command to safely abort an autonmous landing.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPOSITION
entry.description: Reposition the vehicle to a specific WGS84 global position.
entry.param: Ground speed, less than 0 (-1) for default
Bitmask of option flags, see the MAV_DO_REPOSITION_FLAGS enum.
Yaw heading, NaN for unchanged. For planes indicates loiter direction (0: clockwise, 1: counter clockwise)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PAUSE_CONTINUE
entry.description: If in a GPS controlled position mode, hold the current position or continue.
entry.param: 0: Pause current mission or reposition command, hold current position. 1: Continue mission. A VTOL capable vehicle should enter hover mode (multicopter and VTOL planes). A plane should loiter with the default loiter radius.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_REVERSE
entry.description: Set moving direction to forward or reverse.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_VIDEO
entry.description: Control onboard camera system.
entry.param: Transmission: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw
Transmission mode: 0: video stream, >0: single images every n seconds (decimal)
Recording: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Region of intereset mode. (see MAV_ROI enum)
MISSION index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONFIGURE
entry.description: Mission command to configure an on-board camera controller system.
entry.param: Modes: P, TV, AV, M, Etc
Shutter speed: Divisor number for one second
Main engine cut-off time before camera trigger in seconds/10 (0 means no cut-off)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONTROL
entry.description: Mission command to control an on-board camera controller system.
entry.param: Zooming step value to offset zoom from the current position

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE
entry.description: Mission command to configure a camera or antenna mount

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL
entry.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount
entry.param: pitch or lat in degrees, depending on mount mode.
roll or lon in degrees depending on mount mode
yaw or alt (in meters) depending on mount mode

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST
entry.description: Mission command to set CAM_TRIGG_DIST for this flight

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FENCE_ENABLE
entry.description: Mission command to enable the geofence

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PARACHUTE
entry.description: Mission command to trigger a parachute
entry.param: action (0=disable, 1=enable, 2=release, for some systems see PARACHUTE_ACTION enum, not in general message set.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOTOR_TEST
entry.description: Mission command to perform motor test
entry.param: motor sequence number (a number from 1 to max number of motors on the vehicle)
throttle type (0=throttle percentage, 1=PWM, 2=pilot throttle channel pass-through. See MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_TYPE enum)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_INVERTED_FLIGHT
entry.description: Change to/from inverted flight

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SET_YAW_SPEED
entry.description: Sets a desired vehicle turn angle and speed change
entry.param: yaw angle to adjust steering by in centidegress

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL_QUAT
entry.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount, using a quaternion as reference.
entry.param: q1 - quaternion param #1, w (1 in null-rotation)
q2 - quaternion param #2, x (0 in null-rotation)
q3 - quaternion param #3, y (0 in null-rotation)
q4 - quaternion param #4, z (0 in null-rotation)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_MASTER
entry.description: set id of master controller

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_LIMITS
entry.description: set limits for external control
entry.param: timeout - maximum time (in seconds) that external controller will be allowed to control vehicle. 0 means no timeout
absolute altitude min (in meters, AMSL) - if vehicle moves below this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no lower altitude limit
absolute altitude max (in meters)- if vehicle moves above this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no upper altitude limit

horizontal move limit (in meters, AMSL) - if vehicle moves more than this distance from it's location at the moment the command was executed, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no horizontal altitude limit

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ENGINE_CONTROL
entry.description: Control vehicle engine. This is interpreted by the vehicles engine controller to change the target engine state. It is intended for vehicles with internal combustion engines
entry.param: 0: Warm start, 1:Cold start. Controls use of choke where applicable

Height delay (meters). This is for commanding engine start only after the vehicle has gained the specified height. Used in VTOL vehicles during takeoff to start engine after the aircraft is off the ground. Zero for no delay.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the DO commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Trigger calibration. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_SET_SENSOR_OFFSETS
entry.description: Set sensor offsets. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Sensor to adjust the offsets for: 0: gyros, 1: accelerometer, 2: magnetometer, 3: barometer, 4: optical flow, 5: second magnetometer, 6: third magnetometer
X axis offset (or generic dimension 1), in the sensor's raw units
Y axis offset (or generic dimension 2), in the sensor's raw units
Z axis offset (or generic dimension 3), in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 4, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 5, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 6, in the sensor's raw units

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_UAVCAN
entry.description: Trigger UAVCAN config. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: 1: Trigger actuator ID assignment and direction mapping.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE
entry.description: Request storage of different parameter values and logs. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Parameter storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM, 2: Reset to defaults
Mission storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM, 2: Reset to defaults
Onboard logging: 0: Ignore, 1: Start default rate logging, -1: Stop logging, > 1: start logging with rate of param 3 in Hz (e.g. set to 1000 for 1000 Hz logging)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN
entry.description: Request the reboot or shutdown of system components.
entry.param: 0: Do nothing for autopilot, 1: Reboot autopilot, 2: Shutdown autopilot, 3: Reboot autopilot and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded.
0: Do nothing for onboard computer, 1: Reboot onboard computer, 2: Shutdown onboard computer, 3: Reboot onboard computer and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO
entry.description: Hold / continue the current action
entry.param: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD: hold MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE: continue with next item in mission plan
MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION: Hold at current position MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION: hold at specified position
MAV_FRAME coordinate frame of hold point

entry.name: MAV_CMD_MISSION_START
entry.description: start running a mission
entry.param: first_item: the first mission item to run
last_item: the last mission item to run (after this item is run, the mission ends)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM
entry.description: Arms / Disarms a component

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GET_HOME_POSITION
entry.description: Request the home position from the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_START_RX_PAIR
entry.description: Starts receiver pairing

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entry.description: Request the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entry.description: Request the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. This interface replaces REQUEST_DATA_STREAM
entry.param: The interval between two messages, in microseconds. Set to -1 to disable and 0 to request default rate.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_AUTOPILOT_CAPABILITIES
entry.description: Request autopilot capabilities

entry.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_START_CAPTURE
entry.description: Start image capture sequence
entry.param: Duration between two consecutive pictures (in seconds)
Number of images to capture total - 0 for unlimited capture
Resolution in megapixels (0.3 for 640x480, 1.3 for 1280x720, etc)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE
entry.description: Stop image capture sequence

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_TRIGGER_CONTROL
entry.description: Enable or disable on-board camera triggering system.
entry.param: Trigger enable/disable (0 for disable, 1 for start)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_CAPTURE
entry.description: Starts video capture
entry.param: Camera ID (0 for all cameras), 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.
Resolution in megapixels (0.3 for 640x480, 1.3 for 1280x720, etc)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_CAPTURE
entry.description: Stop the current video capture

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PANORAMA_CREATE
entry.description: Create a panorama at the current position
entry.param: Viewing angle horizontal of the panorama (in degrees, +- 0.5 the total angle)
Viewing angle vertical of panorama (in degrees)
Speed of the horizontal rotation (in degrees per second)
Speed of the vertical rotation (in degrees per second)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_VTOL_TRANSITION
entry.description: Request VTOL transition
entry.param: The target VTOL state, as defined by ENUM MAV_VTOL_STATE. Only MAV_VTOL_STATE_MC and MAV_VTOL_STATE_FW can be used.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_STANDARD
entry.description: This command sets the submode to standard guided when vehicle is in guided mode. The vehicle holds position and altitude and the user can input the desired velocites along all three axes.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_CIRCLE
entry.description: This command sets submode circle when vehicle is in guided mode. Vehicle flies along a circle facing the center of the circle. The user can input the velocity along the circle and change the radius. If no input is given the vehicle will hold position.
entry.param: Radius of desired circle in CIRCLE_MODE
Unscaled target latitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE
Unscaled target longitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_PREPARE_DEPLOY
entry.description: Deploy payload on a Lat / Lon / Alt position. This includes the navigation to reach the required release position and velocity.
entry.param: Operation mode. 0: prepare single payload deploy (overwriting previous requests), but do not execute it. 1: execute payload deploy immediately (rejecting further deploy commands during execution, but allowing abort). 2: add payload deploy to existing deployment list.
Desired approach vector in degrees compass heading (0..360). A negative value indicates the system can define the approach vector at will.
Desired ground speed at release time. This can be overriden by the airframe in case it needs to meet minimum airspeed. A negative value indicates the system can define the ground speed at will.
Minimum altitude clearance to the release position in meters. A negative value indicates the system can define the clearance at will.
Latitude unscaled for MISSION_ITEM or in 1e7 degrees for MISSION_ITEM_INT
Longitude unscaled for MISSION_ITEM or in 1e7 degrees for MISSION_ITEM_INT

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_CONTROL_DEPLOY
entry.description: Control the payload deployment.
entry.param: Operation mode. 0: Abort deployment, continue normal mission. 1: switch to payload deploment mode. 100: delete first payload deployment request. 101: delete all payload deployment requests.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_1
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_2
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_3
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_4
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_5
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_1
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_2
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_3
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_4
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_5
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_1
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_2
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_3
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_4
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_5
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

message.name: ALL_FIELD_TYPES
message.description: This message uses every possible base type and even has some nice and long comments that go across multiple lines
message.field: Test field with a nice long description that spans multiple lines eyyyyy! some more info

message.name: ALL_ARRAY_TYPES
message.description: This message uses every possible array type
